original: pariṣecanāntaṃ kṛtvā praṇītāśca vimucya tatassarvamannaṃ hoṣyaṃ ca samupanidhāya hutaśeṣaṃ ca tasman utsṛjya tamuttairastribhiḥ abhimṛśet🔽'eṣa te tata madhumāni'tyetaiḥ /
analyzed: pariṣecana antam kṛtvā praṇītāḥ ca vimucya tatas sarvam annam hoṣyam ca samupanidhāya huta śeṣam ca utsṛjya abhimṛśet  eṣa te tata madhumān iti etaiḥ
translated: Having performed the Pariṣecana rite and released the Pranītā vessels, then having placed all the food to be offered and the remaining oblations, having poured the remaining oblations into it, he should touch it with the three latter (mantras).🔽With these (mantras) beginning with 'This is for you, full of honey'.

analyzed: atra api ūhaḥ eṣa te mātāmaha madhumān ityādi
translated: Here also the arrangement is 'This is for your grandfather, full of honey' etc.

analyzed: tra
translated: Three.

original: atha brāhmaṇabhojanārthahaviṣyamahaviṣayaṃ ca sarvamannaṃ uttaraiḥ 'eṣa te tata madhumān'ityetaistribhirmantraiḥ abhimṛśet /
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇa bhojana artha haviṣyam aha viṣayam ca sarvam annam uttaraiḥ eṣa te tata madhumān iti etaiḥ tribhiḥ mantraiḥ abhimṛśet
translated: Then he should touch all the food, both the sacrificial food for the Brahmins' meal and the ordinary food, with the three verses beginning with This honey-sweet... (RV 1.115.1).

analyzed: eka yatnena sarvasya abhimarśana asambhave mantra āvṛttiḥ
translated: If it is not possible to touch all the food with one effort, the mantra should be repeated.🔽Because the remnants are dependent on the main offering, the remnants are also to be touched.

analyzed: śeṣi paratantra tvāt śeṣāṇām  kḷptān vā pratipūruṣam
translated: Or the portions should be imagined for each person.

original: atha vā bhojanapātreṣu kḷptānodanaviśeṣān pratipuruṣaṃ pṛthagabhimṛśet yathāliṅgam /
analyzed: atha vā bhojana pātreṣu kḷptān odana viśeṣān pratipuruṣam pṛthak abhimṛśet yathāliṅgam
translated: Or he should touch separately in the eating vessels the portions of rice that are imagined for each person, according to the gender of the mantra.

original: tatra yāvantaḥ pitrarthe bhojayante tāvatsu prathamasya mantrasyāvṛttiḥ 'evamuttarayoḥ /
analyzed: tatra yāvantaḥ pitṛ arthe bhojayante tāvatsu prathamasya mantrasya āvṛttiḥ evam uttarayoḥ
translated: There, in the case of those who feed as many Brahmins as there are ancestors, the first mantra is repeated for each, and the same for the other two.

original: tataḥ pātreṣu kaspitānannaśeṣān ////🔽athavā pitrādyarthebhyo brāhmaṇebhyaḥ pratirūrūṣaṃ bhojanapātreṣu kḷptān prakaspitān bhojayapadārthān ekaikena mantreṇa yathāliṅga mabhimṛśet
analyzed: tatas pātreṣu kaspitān anna śeṣān  athavā pitṛ ādi arthebhyaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ pratirūrūṣam bhojana pātreṣu kḷptān prakaspitān ekaikena mantreṇa yathāliṅgam abhimṛśet
translated: Then the remaining food portions in the vessels...🔽Or he should touch with each mantra, according to the gender, the food items that are imagined or portioned out in the eating vessels for each Brahmin for the sake of the ancestors and so on.

original: atrāpi pitrāderekaikasya brāhmaṇabahutve yugapadabhimarśanāsambhave ca tattanmantrāvṛttiḥ ////
analyzed: atra api pitṛ ādeḥ ekaikasya brāhmaṇa bahutve yugapad abhimarśana asambhave ca tad tad mantra āvṛttiḥ
translated: Here too, if there are many Brahmins for each ancestor, and if it is not possible to touch them simultaneously, the respective mantras should be repeated.

analyzed: bhoktṛbhiḥ anna upasparśanam
translated: The touching of the food by the diners.

analyzed: uttareṇa yajuṣā upasparśayitvā
translated: Having touched with the next Yajus,

original: uttareṇa yajuṣā 'pṛthivī te pātra'mityanena brāhmaṇaiḥ sparśayitvā bhojayediti śeṣaḥ /🔽tatra ca 'brāhmaṇānāṃ tvā /
analyzed: uttareṇa yajuṣā pṛthivī te pātram iti anena brāhmaṇaiḥ sparśayitvā bhojayet iti śeṣaḥ  tatra ca brāhmaṇānām tvā
translated: having touched with the next Yajus, with the one beginning The earth is your vessel, he should feed them, the Brahmanas, the rest is understood.

original: 'maiṣāṃ kṣeṣṭhāḥ'iti bahutvaṃ dṛśyate tathāpi pratipuruṣaṃ mantrāvṛttiḥ uparavamantravat /
analyzed: mā eṣām kṣeṣṭhāḥ iti bahu tvam dṛśyate tathā api pratipuruṣam mantra āvṛttiḥ uparava mantra vat
translated: And there, the dual number is seen in of the Brahmanas and may they be your protectors, but still the mantras are repeated for each person, like the Uparava mantras.

analyzed: vatsa apākaraṇa mantravat ca
translated: And like the mantra for removing the calf.

analyzed: tatra devānām upasparśanam viśve
translated: There, first the touching of the food of the gods is with the verse All the gods...

analyzed: iti anayā ṛcā
translated: with this verse.

analyzed: smṛti antare darśanāt  vaiṣṇavyā iti apare
translated: Because it is seen in another Smriti.🔽Others say it is Vaishnava.

analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ ityante viṣṇo havyam rakṣasva iti
translated: At the end, This is Vishnu, O Vishnu, protect the oblation.

analyzed: tathā pitryeṣu api ante viṣṇo kavyam rakṣasva iti
translated: Similarly, at the end of the offerings to the ancestors, O Vishnu, protect the Kavya.

analyzed: bhuñjāneṣu parāṅ āvartate
translated: While they are eating, he turns away.

original: rakṣoghnān pitryān vaiṣṇavyānanyāṃśca pavitrān dharmyān mantrān dharmaśāstra mitihāsapurāṇāṃścābhiśrāvayati /
analyzed: rakṣaḥ ghnān pitryān vaiṣṇavyān anyān ca pavitrān dharmyān mantrān dharma śāstra mitihāsa purāṇān ca abhiśrāvayati
translated: He recites the Rakshas-killing, ancestral, Vaishnava, and other sacred and righteous mantras, the Dharma Shastras, Itihasa, and Puranas.

original: tatastṛptāni jñātvā madhumatīḥ śrāvayet akṣannamīmadanteti ca /
analyzed: tatas tṛptāni jñātvā madhumatīḥ śrāvayet akṣan amīmadanta iti ca
translated: Then, knowing they are satisfied, he should recite the auspicious verses They have eaten, they have rejoiced... and Akshan.

original: atha bhūmāvannaṃ vikarati'ye agnidagdhā ye 'nagnigdhā ye vā jātāḥ kule mama /
analyzed: atha bhūmau annam vikarati ye agni dagdhāḥ ye na agnigdhāḥ ye vā jātāḥ kule mama
translated: Then he scatters food on the ground, with the verse, 'Those who have been burnt by fire, those who have not been burnt by fire, those who have been born in my family,

original: bhūmau dattena piṇaḍena tṛptā yāntu parāṃ gati'miti /
analyzed: bhūmau dattena piṇaḍena tṛptāḥ yāntu parām gatim iti
translated: may they, being satisfied with the ball of food offered on the ground, go to the highest state.'

original: athācānteṣu punarapo datvā 'svadita'miti pitrartān vācayati 'rocata'iti vāśvadevārtān /
analyzed: atha ācānteṣu punar apaḥ da tvā svaditam iti pitṛ ṛtān vācayati rocata eti vāśvadeva ārtān
translated: Then, after they have sipped water, he again gives them water, and makes the Pitṛs recite the formula 'Svadita' or the Aśvadeva Pitṛs recite the formula 'Rocata.'

original: tato yathāśraddhaṃ dakṣiṇāṃ datvā sarvebhyo 'nnaśeṣebhyaḥ piṇḍārtha prāśanārthañcoddhṛtya śeṣaṃ nivedayotannaśeṣaiḥ kiṃ kriyatāṃ iti /
analyzed: tatas yathāśraddham dakṣiṇām da tvā sarvebhyaḥ nna śeṣebhyaḥ piṇḍa artha prāśana artham ca uddhṛtya śeṣam nivedaya uta anna śeṣaiḥ kim kriyatām iti
translated: Then, after giving them dakṣiṇā according to his faith, he collects the remaining food from all the leftovers for the balls and for eating, and informs them, 'What shall be done with the remaining food?'

analyzed: iṣṭaiḥ saha upabhujyatām iti prativacanam
translated: The reply is, 'Let it be enjoyed together with the desired ones.'

analyzed: dātāraḥ naḥ bhivardantām vedāḥ santatiḥ eva naḥ
translated: 'May the givers prosper for us, may the Vedas and progeny be ours.

original: śraddhā ca no mā vyapagāt bahudeyaṃ ca no 'stu' / //
analyzed: śraddhā ca naḥ mā vyapagāt bahudeyam ca naḥ stu
translated: May our faith never fail, and may we have much to give.'

analyzed: iti prārthayate
translated: Thus he prays.

analyzed: dātāraḥ vaḥ bhivardhantām iti ūhena prativacanam
translated: The reply is with the formula 'May the givers prosper for you.'

analyzed: bhuktavataḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya
translated: After they have eaten, he circumambulates them,

analyzed: namaskāraḥ
translated: and bows.

analyzed: om svadhā iti pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: 'Om, Svadhā' to the Pitṛs.

analyzed: viśvedevāḥ prīyantām iti viśveṣām devānām
translated: 'May the Viśvedevas be pleased' to the Viśvedevas.

original: tatra sarvakarmaṇāṃ vaiśvadeveṣu pūrva pravṛttiḥ paścāt pitryeṣu /
analyzed: tatra sarva karmaṇām vaiśvadeveṣu pūrva pravṛttiḥ paścāt pitryeṣu
translated: Among them, the performance of all rites is first in the Vaiśvadeva offerings, and later in the offerings to the ancestors.

analyzed: visarjane viparyayaḥ
translated: The reverse is true for the dismissal.

analyzed: abhiśravaṇa ādi yajña upavītī prāk piṇḍebhyaḥ kalpa antara darśanāt
translated: One should perform the abhiśravas and other rites with the sacred thread over the left shoulder, before the piṇḍas, because of the description in other Dharmaśāstras.

analyzed: uttareṇa pṛthivī te pātram iti anena yajuṣā
translated: With the Yajuṣ mantra beginning with The earth is your vessel (Pāraskara Grhyasūtra 3.1.1).

analyzed: kḷpta an anna aviśeṣān brāhmaṇān
translated: To the Brahmins who have been assigned special food portions.

analyzed: haste gṛhītvā upasparśayitvā
translated: Having taken them by the hand and made them touch (the food),

analyzed: tam bhojayet iti śeṣaḥ
translated: he should feed them, this is the remainder.

original: atra ca mantre yadyapi brāhmaṇānāmiti bahuvacanaṃ tatāpi yugapat sparsāyitumaśakyatvāt pratipūruṣaṃ mantrāvṛttiḥ /🔽yathā'vāyavasstha'tai / saṃ
analyzed: atra ca mantre yadi api brāhmaṇānām iti bahuvacanam yugapad sparsāyitum aśakya tvāt pratipūruṣam mantra āvṛttiḥ  yathā vāyavaḥ sthatai
translated: And although here in the mantra there is the plural of the Brahmins, still because it is not possible to make them touch simultaneously, the mantra is repeated for each person.🔽Just as the mantra The winds are standing (Taittirīya Samhitā 1.1.1.1)

analyzed: iti mantraḥ prativatsam
translated: is for each calf.

analyzed: evaṃvidheṣu bahuvacanam prayoga sādhu tva artha  eka prayoga vacana prayojya aneka vyaktyāḥ abhiprāyam vā
translated: In such cases, the plural is for the sake of correctness in usage.🔽Or it may be intended to refer to the many individuals that are the subject of the statement of a single performance.

analyzed: bhuktavatām anuvrajanam
translated: Following the fed ones.

analyzed: piṇḍa dānam
translated: Giving the piṇḍas.

analyzed: śeṣa bhakṣaṇam ca
translated: And eating the leftovers.

original: bhuktavato 'nuvrajya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya dvaidhaṃ dakṣiṇāgrān darbhān saṃstīrya teṣūttarairapo
analyzed: bhuktavataḥ nuvrajya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya dvaidham dakṣiṇa agrān darbhān saṃstīrya teṣu uttaraiḥ apaḥ
translated: Having followed the fed ones, circumambulated them, spread darbha grass with the tips pointing to the south in two rows, and on them with the next (mantra),

analyzed: datvā uttaraiḥ dakṣiṇa apavargān piṇḍān datvā pūrvavat uttaraiḥ apaḥ datvā uttaraiḥ upasthāya uttarayā uda pātreṇa
translated: Having offered the southern cakes with the next (verses), having offered water with the next (verses) as before, having served with the next (verses), with the next (verse) with the water-pot,

original: triḥprasavyaṃ pariṣicya nyubjya pātrāṇyuttaraṃ yajuranavānaṃ tryavarārghyamāvartayitvā🔽prokṣyapātrāṇi dvandvamabhyudāhṛtya sarvatassamavadāyottareṇa yajuṣā śeṣasya grāsavarārghya
analyzed: tris prasavyam pariṣicya nyubjya pātrāṇi uttaram yajuḥ an avānam tryavara arghyam āvartayitvā  prokṣya pātrāṇi dvandvam abhyudāhṛtya sarvatas samavadāya uttareṇa yajuṣā śeṣasya
translated: having sprinkled (the cakes) three times from left to right, having bent down the vessels, having repeated the next Yajus at least three times without a break,

analyzed: prāśnīyāt
translated: having sprinkled the vessels, having recited the Dvandva (hymn), having collected everything from all sides, he should eat of the remainder at least one mouthful with the next Yajus.

original: tatastānbhuktavato 'nuvrajya pradīkṣaṇīkṛtyapratyāvṛtya prācīnāvītī piṇḍapradānadeśe dakṣiṇāgrān darbhān
analyzed: tatas tān bhuktavataḥ nuvrajya pradīkṣaṇīkṛtya pratyāvṛtya prācīnāvītī piṇḍa pradāna deśe dakṣiṇa agrān darbhān
translated: Then, having followed them while they are eating, having made them take the Pradisha (food), having turned back, wearing his sacred cord over his right shoulder, he strews Darbha grass with its points towards the south

analyzed: saṃstṛṇāti dvaidham dvayoḥ sthānayoḥ a saṃbhinnān iti arthaḥ
translated: in the place where the cakes are offered. The meaning is that (he strews it) in two places without mixing (the two sets of grass).

analyzed: tatra pitṛbhyaḥ purastāt stṛmāti
translated: There he strews (grass) for the fathers in front.

analyzed: mātṛbhyaḥ paścāt
translated: For the mothers behind.

analyzed: tathā ca āśvalāyanaḥ karṣūṣu eke vā
translated: And so says Asvalayana: In the furrows, some in two, or in six.

analyzed: pūrvāsu pitṛbyaḥ dadyāt
translated: He should offer in the eastern ones to the fathers,

analyzed: aparāsu strībhyaḥ iti
translated: in the western ones to the women.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa agraiḥ
translated: With points towards the south in the rites for the fathers.

analyzed: iti asya paristaraṇī vaṣaya tvāt iha dakṣiṇīni iti uktam
translated: This refers to the strewing (of grass), therefore here it is said with points towards the south.

analyzed: saṃstīrya teṣu uttaraiḥ mantraiḥ mārjayantām mama pitaraḥ etyādibhiḥ apaḥ dadāti
translated: Having spread (the Darbha grass), he offers water with the subsequent Mantras beginning with 'May my Fathers cleanse themselves,' etc.

analyzed: pūrvavat iti vakṣyamāṇa mantra api apakṛṣyante
translated: The Mantras to be recited are to be taken from the section on the Pindapitriyajna.

original: piṇḍaṃ pūrvavat dadāti piṇḍapitṛyajñe yat piṇḍadānaṃ tadityarthaḥ /
analyzed: piṇḍam pūrvavat dadāti piṇḍapitṛyajñe yat piṇḍa dānam tat iti arthaḥ
translated: He gives the Pindas as before; that is, he gives the Pindas which are offered at the Pindapitriyajna.

original: tena trīnudakāñjalīnityevamādayoviśeṣā ihāpi bhavanti /🔽tatra pitṛliṅgaiḥ pitṛbhyastīrṇeṣu /
analyzed: tena trīn udaka añjalīn iti evamādayaḥ viśeṣāḥ iha api bhavanti  tatra pitṛ liṅgaiḥ pitṛbhyaḥ tīrṇeṣu
translated: Therefore, the special rules such as 'three handfuls of water,' etc., are also to be observed here.🔽There, on the Darbha grass spread with the Mantras containing the word 'Father,' he offers water to the Fathers.

analyzed: mātṛ liṅgaiḥ mātṛbhyaḥ tīrṇeṣu
translated: On the Darbha grass spread with the Mantras containing the word 'Mother,' he offers water to the Mothers.

original: evamapo datvā tata uttarairmantraiḥ 'etatte tatāsā'vityādibhisteṣu darbheṣūbhayeṣudakṣiṇāpavargān piṇḍān dadāti yathāliṅgaṃ pitṛbhyaśca mātṛbhyaśca
analyzed: evam apaḥ da tvā tatas uttaraiḥ mantraiḥ etat te tata asau ityādibhiḥ teṣu darbheṣu ubhayeṣu dakṣiṇā apavargān piṇḍān dadāti yathāliṅgam pitṛbhyaḥ ca mātṛbhyaḥ ca
translated: Having offered water thus, he then offers the Pindas on those Darbha blades, both to the Fathers and to the Mothers, with the subsequent Mantras beginning with 'This is for you, O Tatatasa,' etc., in the order from right to left.

analyzed: asau iti atra sarvatra nāma grahaṇam yathāliṅgam
translated: In the Mantra 'Asau,' etc., the name is to be inserted according to the gender.

original: atrāpi pūrvavadityasya sabandhāt savyaṃ jānvācyāvācīnapāṇirityādi vidhānamihāpi bhavati /
analyzed: atra api pūrvavat ityasya sabandhāt savyam jānu ācya avācīna pāṇiḥ ityādi vidhānam iha api bhavati
translated: Here also, because of the connection with 'as before,' the rules such as 'with the left knee touching the ground, with the right hand,' etc., are to be observed here also.

analyzed: aneka pitṛkasya ūhaḥ iti paiṅgi sūtram
translated: The Paiṅgi Sūtra says that if there are many Fathers,

analyzed: etat vām tatau yajñaśarma viṣṇuśarmāṇau ye ca yuvām anu
translated: 'This is for you, O Tatatasa, Yajñaśarman and Viṣṇuśarman, and for those whom you follow,

analyzed: etat vām pitāmahau vityādi
translated: The text beginning with This is for you, O grandfathers etc.

original: etadvāṃ mātarāvasau yāśca yuvāmanu'ityādidakṣiṇāpavargānityucyateubhayeṣāṃ piṇḍānāṃ pṛthak dakṣiṇāpavargatā yathā syāditi /
analyzed: etat vām mātarā avasau yāḥ ca yuvām anu ityādi dakṣiṇā apavargān iti ucyate ubhayeṣām piṇḍānām pṛthak dakṣiṇā apavarga tā yathā syāt iti
translated: It is said that the text beginning with This is for you, O mothers, and for those who follow you etc. ends in the south, so that the balls of both may be separately discharged in the south.

original: tena pitṛpiṇḍānāṃ dakṣiṇato mātṛpiṇḍā na bhavanti /
analyzed: tena pitṛ piṇḍānām dakṣiṇatas mātṛ piṇḍāḥ na bhavanti
translated: Therefore, the balls of the mothers are not to the south of the balls of the fathers.

analyzed: kim tarhi paścāt
translated: What then? They are to the west.

original: evaṃ piṇḍān datvā pūrvavaduttarairapo dadāti pitṛbhyaśca mātṛbhyaśca /
analyzed: evam piṇḍān da tvā pūrvavat uttaraiḥ apaḥ dadāti pitṛbhyaḥ ca mātṛbhyaḥ ca
translated: Having thus offered the balls, he offers water with the subsequent (verses) as before, to the fathers and to the mothers.

original: mantrasamāmnāye'mārjantāṃ mama pitara ityete'iti mantrāṇāṃ punarādiṣṭatvāt 'uttarairapo
analyzed: mantra samāmnāye mārjantām mama pitaraḥ iti ete iti mantrāṇām punar ādiṣṭa tvāt uttaraiḥ apaḥ
translated: Because the mantras are recited again, as in May my fathers wipe (their faces) etc., the word subsequent is used in the text having offered (the balls).

original: datvā'ityeva siddhe pūrvavadityatidśaḥ piṇḍapitṛyajñapratyavamarśanārthaḥ piṇḍeṣu codakāñjaliṣu ca /
analyzed: da tvā iti eva siddhe pūrvavat iti atidūraḥ piṇḍapitṛyajña pratyavamarśana arthaḥ piṇḍeṣu ca udaka añjaliṣu ca
translated: The word as before is added for the purpose of referring to the ball-offering and the libation of water.

original: tata uttarairmantraiḥ tānupatiṣṭhate yathāliṅgaṃ 'ye ca vo 'treti pitṝn /
analyzed: tatas uttaraiḥ mantraiḥ tān upatiṣṭhate yathāliṅgam ye ca vaḥ trā iti pitṝn
translated: Then he worships them with the subsequent mantras according to their meaning: the fathers with Those of you who are here,

original: yāśca ve 'treti mātṝ /🔽te ca vahantāmiti pitṛn /
analyzed: yāḥ ca ve trā iti mātṝ  te ca vahantām iti pitṛn
translated: the mothers with Those of you who are here,🔽the fathers with May they carry,

original: tāśca vahantāniti mātṝḥ /🔽tṛpyaṃtu bhavta iti pitṝn /
analyzed: tāḥ ca mātṝḥ  tṛpyaṃtu bhavtaḥ iti pitṝn
translated: the mothers with May they carry,🔽the fathers with May you be satisfied,

analyzed: tṛpyaṃtu bhavatyaḥ iti mātṝḥ
translated: the mothers with May you be satisfied.

analyzed: tṛpyata tṛpyata tṛpyata iti ubhayān
translated: With Be satisfied, be satisfied, be satisfied, (he should offer) to both.

original: tata uttarayarcā 'putrān pautrānityetayātriḥ prasavyamudapātreṇa pimḍān pariṣiñcati / ubhayāstaparyantviti lṅgāt piṇḍānāṃ sahapariṣecanam /

translated: And in everything else except this, the sacred thread is worn over the right shoulder until the completion.

analyzed: etat ca prāk eva upapāditam
translated: And this has been explained before.

original: kartuścātra saṅkalpādārabhya āsamāpterbrahmacaryādivratacaryā anaśanaṃ ca bhavati /
analyzed: kartuḥ ca atra saṅkalpāt ārabhya ā samāpteḥ brahmacarya ādi vrata caryā anaśanam ca bhavati
translated: And for the performer here, from the beginning of the resolution until the completion, there is the observance of the vow of celibacy etc. and fasting.

analyzed: bhoktṝṇām api krodha tva ādiḥ
translated: And for the enjoyers also, the one stated by Manu, beginning with non-anger.

original: athāparedyuḥ prātastān brāhmaṇān gṛhamānīya ācāntānāsaneṣūpaveśya pūrvavaddvitāyamāmantraṇam /
analyzed: atha aparedyus prātar tān brāhmaṇān gṛham ānīya ācāntān āsaneṣu upaveśya pūrvavat dvitāyam āmantraṇam

analyzed: atra tu adya śrāddham bhaviṣyati iti bhedaḥ
translated: But here the difference is that it is said Today your Śrāddha will take place.

original: 'pūrvedyurnivedanaṃ aparedyurdvitīyaṃ tṛtāyaṃ cāmantraṇam'itivacanāt /🔽atha teṣāṃ pādān kuṇḍeṣu sakūrcatileṣvavanijyācamayya /
analyzed: pūrvedyus nivedanam aparedyus dvitīyam tṛtāyam ca āmantraṇam iti vacanāt  atha teṣām pādān kuṇḍeṣu sa kūrca tileṣu avanijya ācamayya
translated: Because of the statement: The announcement on the previous day, the second on the next day, and the invitation on the third day.🔽Then, having worshipped their feet in the fire pits along with the Kūrca and sesame seeds, and having made them rinse their mouths,

analyzed: kṛsara tāmbūla ādīni da tvā abhyajya snāna artha prasthāpayet
translated: having given them gruel, betel leaves, etc., having anointed them, he should send them off for bathing.

analyzed: te ca snāyuḥ
translated: And they should bathe.

original: tatassvayaṃ ca snāto brāhmaṇa bhojanārthādannādanyenānnena vaiśvadevaṃ pañcamahāyajñāṃśca kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas svayam ca snātaḥ brāhmaṇa bhojana arthāt annāt anyena annena vaiśvadevam pañcamahāyajñān ca kuryāt
translated: Then, having bathed himself, he should perform the Vaiśvadeva and the five great sacrifices with food other than that intended for the Brāhmaṇas' meal.

analyzed: kecid samāpte śrāddhe iti
translated: Some say after the Śrāddha is completed.

analyzed: tatas parāhṇe prācīnāvītī brāhmaṇān prakṣālita pāṇi pādān ācāntān āsaneṣu upaveśayati
translated: Then in the afternoon, wearing the sacred thread over the right shoulder, he seats the Brāhmaṇas, who have washed their hands and feet and sipped water, on seats.

original: tatra viśvadevārthān prāṅmukhān prākkūleṣu darbheṣu pitrādyarthānudaṅmukhān dviguṇabhugneṣu dakṣiṇāgreṣu darbheṣu /
analyzed: tatra viśvadeva arthān prāc mukhān prāc kūleṣu darbheṣu pitṛ ādi arthān udak mukhān dviguṇa bhugneṣu dakṣiṇa agreṣu darbheṣu
translated: There, those for the Viśvedevas facing east, on eastward-pointed Darbha grass, and those for the ancestors etc. facing north, on northward-pointed Darbha grass folded in two.

original: śrāddhāgāraṃ ca sucau deśe dakṣiṇāpravaṇe sarvataḥ pariśritamudagdvāraṃ ca bhavati /
analyzed: śrāddha āgāram ca sucau deśe dakṣiṇā pravaṇe sarvatas pariśritam udak dvāram ca bhavati
translated: And the Śrāddha house is in a very clean place, sloping towards the south, enclosed on all sides, and has its door in the north.

analyzed: tasya uttarapūrva deśe gniḥ aupāsanaḍaḥ
translated: In the north-east part of it is the domestic fire.

analyzed: agni dakṣiṇatas piṇḍa pradāna artha sthaṇaḍilam
translated: To the south of the fire is a raised platform for offering the balls of rice.

analyzed: tasya dakṣiṇatas ptṛ ādi arthānām āsanam
translated: To the south of that, seats for the sake of the father and others.

analyzed: paścāt tu viśvedeva arthānām āsanam
translated: To the west, seats for the sake of the Viśvedevas.

original: sthaṇḍileṣu yathāvakāśaṃ pitrādibhyasriṣu pātreṣu ekasmin vā śāstrāntaroktavidhinārghyārthamudakagrahaṇam /
analyzed: sthaṇḍileṣu yathāvakāśam pātreṣu ekasmin vā śāstra antara ukta vidhinā arghya artham udaka grahaṇam
translated: In the sacrificial pits, in three vessels for the father and others, or in one vessel, according to the method stated in other scriptures, water should be taken for the sake of the Arghya offering, according to the available space.

analyzed: viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ ca yathāvidhi pātra antare
translated: And in another vessel, according to the prescribed method, for the Viśvedevas.

original: tāni gandhādibhirabhyarcya /🔽darbheṣu sādayitvā darbhaiḥ pracchādyāthāsanagatānāṃ brāhmaṇānāṃ hasteṣu svasmātsvasmādudapātrātpātrāntareṇāpa
analyzed: tāni gandha ādibhiḥ abhyarcya  darbheṣu sādayitvā darbhaiḥ pracchādya atha āsana gatānām brāhmaṇānām hasteṣu svasmāt svasmāt uda pātrāt pātra antareṇa apa
translated: Having worshipped those with perfumes etc.,🔽having placed them on the Darbha grass, having covered them with Darbha grass, from each of their own water pots, with another vessel,

original: ādāya 'viśva devāḥ idaṃ vo arghya''pitṛpitāmahaprapitāmahāidaṃ vo arghya 'iti vārghyāṇi dadāti /
analyzed: ādāya viśva devāḥ idam vaḥ arghya pitṛ pitāmaha prapitāmahāḥ idam vaḥ arghyaḥ iti vā arghyāṇi dadāti
translated: taking (the water) in the hands of the Brahmins who are seated in their respective seats, he offers the Arghya water with the mantras, This is the Arghya for the Viśvedevas, This is the Arghya for the father, grandfather, and great-grandfather.

analyzed: idam eva arghya dānam śrāddhe svadhā ninayanam uda pātra ānayanam iti ca ucyate
translated: This very offering of Arghya is called the offering of Svadhā in a Śrāddha, and the bringing of the water pot.

analyzed: purastāt upariṣṭāt ca arghya dānāt hasteṣu śuddha udaka dānam
translated: Before and after the offering of Arghya, pure water should be offered in the hands.

analyzed: tatas gandha ādibhiḥ vāsobhiḥ aṅgulīyaka ādibhiḥ ca yathāvibhavam brāhmaṇānām abhyarcanam
translated: Then, according to one's means, the Brahmins should be worshipped with perfumes etc., garments, rings etc.

analyzed: tatas tān uddhriyatām agnau ca griyatām iti pratibrūyuḥ
translated: Then they should reply, Let it be taken out and let it be offered into the fire.

analyzed: udīcya vṛttiḥ tu āsana gatānām hasteṣu uda pātra ānayanam
translated: The northern practice is to bring water pots into the hands of those seated.

original: uddhriyatāmagnau ca kriyatā mityāmantrayate /🔽kāmamuddhiyatākāmamagnau ca kriyatāmityatisṛṣṭa uddharejjuhuyācca'āpa /dha / / /
analyzed: uddhriyatām agnau ca kriyatām miti āmantrayate  kāmam uddhiyata akāmam agnau ca kriyatām iti atisṛṣṭa

analyzed: iti dharma śāstra vacanāt
translated: Let it be taken out as one wishes, let it be done in the fire as one wishes, having been thus permitted, he should take out and offer, according to the text of the Dharma Shastra, Water, etc.

analyzed: etat śoda pātra ānayanam uddhriyatām iti āmantraṇam ca pākṣikam
translated: This bringing of the water pots and the invitation to take out are optional,

analyzed: bhāṣyakāreṇa anukta tvāt
translated: because they are not mentioned by the author of the commentary.

analyzed: kṣāra ādi saṃsṛṣṭam anyasmin pātre uddhṛtya atha haviṣyam agneḥ upasamādhāna ādi agni mukha antam
translated: mixed with alkaline substances, etc., then having placed the sacrificial oblations in the fire, having added fuel to the fire, etc., up to the end of the fire-mouth rite,

analyzed: kṛtvā yat me mātā ityādibhiḥ trayodaśa pradhāna āhutīḥ hutvā sviṣṭakṛtam ca tatas udīcīnam uṣṇam
translated: Having offered thirteen principal oblations with (the verses), 'What my mother' , &c., and also the Svishtakrit oblation, he should then remove the hot ashes to the north,

analyzed: bhasma apohya a haviṣyam svāhākāreṇa hutvā atha lepayoḥ ityādi tantra śeṣam samāpya tatas

translated: Then the acceptation of the guests is 'We will obtain' .

analyzed: tatas brāhmaṇam dakṣiṇatas niṣādya

analyzed: ityādi agni mukha ante kṛte pāda prakṣālana ādi

analyzed: annam uddhtya pradhāna homa ādayaḥ iti

original: pratiṣṭhitābhidhāraṇānte kṛte agnerupasamādhājyabhāgāntaṃ kṛtvā pārvaṇavadavadānakalpenāpūpāduttarayarcā añjalinā juhoti 'yāṃ janāḥ pratinandantī'tyetayā🔽sāmarthyādupastaraṇābhighāraṇayoravadānasya cānyaḥ kartā /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhita abhidhāraṇa ante kṛte agneḥ upasamādhā ājyabhāga antam kṛtvā pārvaṇa vat avadāna kalpena apūpāt uttarayā ṛcā añjalinā juhoti yām janāḥ pratinandanti iti etayā  sāmarthyāt upastaraṇa abhighāraṇayoḥ avadānasya ca anyaḥ kartā
translated: When the installation and consecration are finished, having performed the rites up to the offering of ghee into the fire, he offers the cake with the northern verse, That which the people rejoice in, in a handful, according to the rule of portions as in the Parvana rite.🔽By implication, the spreading, pouring over, and the portioning are done by someone else.

analyzed: ājyabhāga anta vacanam tantra vidhāna artham
translated: The statement ending with the offering of ghee is for the purpose of prescribing the procedure.

analyzed: etat eva jñāpakam na pitryam etat karma iti
translated: This very indication is that this rite is not for the ancestors.

original: anyathā yathā māsiśrāddhe 'ṣṭakāyāṃ ca yatnābhāve 'pi tantraṃ pravartate /
analyzed: anyathā yathā māsiśrāddhe ṣṭakāyām ca yatna abhāve tantram pravartate
translated: Otherwise, just as the procedure continues even in the absence of effort in the monthly Śrāddha and the Aṣṭakā rite,

analyzed: pitryeṣu yatna abhāve iti ukta tvāt
translated: because it has been stated that even in the absence of effort in the rites for the ancestors, the procedure continues,

analyzed: tathā atra api siddham syāt
translated: it would be established in this case also.

original: pārvaṇavadvacanaṃ añjalihomānāmadharmagrāhakatvāt avadānakalpaprāptyartha añjalināpi juhvat pārvaṇavadavadānakalpena juhotīti /
analyzed: pārvaṇa vat vacanam añjali homānām adharma grāhaka tvāt avadāna kalpa prāpti artha añjalinā api juhvat pārvaṇa vat avadāna kalpena juhoti iti
translated: The statement as in the Parvana rite is for the purpose of obtaining the rule of portions by means of a handful, because the handful offerings convey the Dharma, that one who offers even with a handful offers according to the rule of portions as in the Parvana rite.

analyzed: sādana prokṣaṇa sam mārjanāni añjaleḥ na bhavanti
translated: The spreading, sprinkling, and wiping are not done with the handful.

analyzed: tatas pārvaṇa vat agneḥ upasamādhāna ādi agni mukha ante
translated: Then, as in the Parvana rite, from the kindling of the fire up to the end of the fire-mouth.

analyzed: svakīyena avadāna dharmeṇa apūpāt puroḍāśāt vā avadāya uttarayā ṛcā yām janāḥ pratinandanti
translated: With his own Avadāna rite, he takes a portion from the cake, and offers it with the subsequent Ṛc That which people praise .

analyzed: iti etayā añjalinā juhoti
translated: He offers it with folded hands.

analyzed: añjaleḥ tu yena juhoti ityādi saṃskāra lepa añjanam upastaraṇa abhigāraṇa haviḥ avadānāni ca vipratiṣedhāt anyaḥ kuryāt
translated: But the purification, anointing, spreading, sprinkling, and taking portions of the oblation in the case of the folded hands should be done by another, because of the prohibition.

original: sviṣṭakṛtaṃ tu darvyaiva juhoti /🔽nāñjalinā /vikṛtau codyamāno dharmaḥ pradhānārtho bhavatīti nyāyāt /
analyzed: sviṣṭakṛtam tu darvyā eva juhoti  na añjalinā avikṛtau codyamānaḥ dharmaḥ pradhāna arthaḥ bhavati iti nyāyāt
translated: But the Sviṣṭakṛt offering he makes with the Darvī ladle itself.🔽Not with the folded hands. Because it is the rule that a rite enjoined in a modification is for the sake of the primary rite.

analyzed: na ca vācyam aupakāryasya aṅga tvāt prādhānyam eva na asti iti
translated: And it should not be said that it is not primary because of being subordinate.

analyzed: yatas sya api sva aṅga apekṣayā prādhānyam asti eva
translated: Because it too has primacy in relation to its own parts.

analyzed: atas eva mandam dīkṣaṇīyāyām anuvrūyāt apaśrau
translated: For this very reason, He should recite the Dīkṣaṇīyā softly .

analyzed: iti vāc niyamaḥ soma aṅga bhūta dīkṣaṇīyā pradhāna mātra arthaḥ na tad aṅga prayāja ādi arthaḥ
translated: Thus the restriction on speech is only for the sake of the primary Dīkṣaṇīyā, which is a part of the Soma, not also for the sake of the Prayāja etc., which are its parts.

analyzed: tathā tatas tūṣṇīm ā agnihotram
translated: Similarly, Then he offers the Agnihotra silently .

original: iti tūṣṇīkatvamādhānāṅgabhūtasya naiyamikāgnihotravikṛteḥ pradhānasyaiva dharmaḥ na tadaṅgānāmapīti /
analyzed: iti tūṣṇīka tvam ādhāna aṅga bhūtasya naiyamika agnihotra vikṛteḥ pradhānasya eva dharmaḥ na tad aṅgānām api iti
translated: Thus, the dharma of the principal sacrifice alone, which is a part of the establishment of silence, is for the original Agnihotra, not for its parts either.

original: aupakāryasya cauṣadhihavuṣkatvādeva siddhasya tantrasya punarvacanaṃ etatsnāpannadadhihome 'pi prāptyarthamityuktameva //// thā
analyzed: aupakāryasya ca oṣadhi havuṣka tvāt eva siddhasya tantrasya punarvacanam prāpti artham iti uktam eva
translated: And it has been said that the restatement of the Tantra, which is established by the mere fact of being helpful, is for the purpose of obtaining it even in the Dadhihotra performed after bathing.

analyzed: śeṣasya aṣṭadhā kṛtasya brāhmaṇebhyaḥ upaharaṇam
translated: The remainder, divided into eight parts, is to be offered to the Brahmins.

analyzed: siddhaḥ śeṣaḥ tam aṣṭadhā kṛtvā ābrahmaṇebhyaḥ upaharati
translated: Having divided the completed remainder into eight parts, he offers it to the Brahmins.

analyzed: tantrasya śeṣaḥ siddhaḥ bhavati avikṛtaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The remainder of the Tantra becomes completed, meaning it remains unmodified.

original: añjalinā juhotītyubhayaṃ viśeṣaḥ sviṣṭakṛti na bhavatītiyarthaḥ /
analyzed: añjalinā juhoti iti ubhayam viśeṣaḥ sviṣṭakṛti na bhavati iti yarthaḥ
translated: The two special features are that he offers with cupped hands and that it is not a Svistakṛt offering.

original: tena sviṣṭakṛtamavadānakalpena darvyā hutvā samidhamekaviṃśatimādhāya jayādi pratipadyate ////
analyzed: tena sviṣṭakṛtam avadāna kalpena darvyā hutvā samidham ekaviṃśatim ādhāya jaya ādi pratipadyate
translated: Having offered the Svistakṛt with the ladle according to the rule of taking portions, having placed the twenty-first fire-stick, he begins with the Jaya (hymn), etc.

original: 'tena sarpiṣmatā brāhmaṇa'mityayekasya bhakṣaṇe prāpte 'ṣṭābhya ipahāro vidhāyate /
analyzed: tena sarpiṣmatā brāhmaṇam ityayā ikasya bhakṣaṇe prāpte ṣṭābhyaḥ ipahāraḥ vidhāyate
translated: When it is obtained that one should eat with ghee, the offering to the eight is enjoined.

original: tatra ye brāhmaṇāḥ śvobhūte bhoktāraḥ tebhyo nivedyopavasati // //
analyzed: tatra ye brāhmaṇāḥ śvobhūte bhoktāraḥ tebhyaḥ nivedya upavasati
translated: There, having informed those Brahmins who will eat the next day, he observes the fast.

analyzed: upaharati prāśana artham iti ca anuvādaḥ
translated: The statement he offers the remaining part of the cake for tasting is a restatement.

original: taṃ śeṣaṃ sarpiṣmantamaṣṭadhā kṛtvā aṣṭaphyo brahmaṇebhyaiti vidhātum /
analyzed: tam śeṣam sarpiṣmantam aṣṭadhā kṛtvā aṣṭaphyaḥ vidhātum
translated: Having divided that remainder into eight parts, he offers it to the eight Brahmins for the purpose of injunction.

analyzed: tena iha brāhmaṇa eka tva bādhaḥ
translated: By that, the oneness of the Brahmins here is contradicted.

analyzed: kecid siddhaḥ śeṣaḥ iti sūtracchedaḥ
translated: Some divide the sutra as the remaining part is ready.

analyzed: siddhaḥ vikṛtaḥ tantrasya śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder of the ritual is ready, unmodified.

analyzed: tena darvyā homaḥ sviṣṭakṛtaḥ
translated: By that, the sviṣṭakṛt offering is made with the ladle.

original: jayādi pratipadyata iti ca siddhamiti teṣāṃ tamaṣṭadhetyatra tamapūpamiti vyavahitasya parāmarśo bhavet /
analyzed: jaya ādi pratipadyate iti ca siddham iti teṣām tam aṣṭadhā iti atra tam apūpam iti vyavahitasya parāmarśaḥ bhavet
translated: And the statement one begins with jaya etc. is ready. For them, the reference to that cake would be indirect in that in into eight parts.

analyzed: evam aupakārya kṛtvā brāhmaṇebhyaḥ nivedayet
translated: Having thus performed the service, he should inform the Brahmins who will partake in the monthly śrāddha.

analyzed: śvas ṣṭakā śrāddham bhaviṣyati iti bhedaḥ
translated: Tomorrow there will be an aṣṭakā śrāddha. This is the difference.

analyzed: goḥ upākaraṇam
translated: The consecration of the cow.

analyzed: śvobhūte darbheṇa gām upākaroti pitṛbhyaḥ tvā juṣṭām upākaromi iti
translated: The next day, he consecrates the cow with a darbha grass, saying I consecrate you for the Manes.

analyzed: darbheṇa iti ekatvam avivakṣitam
translated: With darbha grass - the singularity is not intended.

analyzed: gām striyam
translated: The cow, a female.

analyzed: juṣṭa amitā ilṅgāt
translated: Consecrated - from the elṅ affix.

analyzed: purastāt pratīcīm tiṣṭhantīm
translated: Standing in front, facing west.

analyzed: śraute tathā darśanāt
translated: Because it is seen so in the Śruti.

analyzed: pitryam ca ā
translated: And it is for the Manes.

analyzed: ṭakā karma pitṛbhyaḥ tvā a juṣṭām iti darśanāt
translated: The act of cutting is to be done. Because it is seen that the oblation is offered to the ancestors.

original: pitryeṣu yatnamantareṇāpi tantraṃ pravartate iti purastāduktam /
analyzed: pitryeṣu yatnam antareṇa api tantram pravartate iti purastāt uktam
translated: It has been said before that in the rites for the ancestors, the procedure proceeds even without effort.

original: tata ājyabhāgānte tantre kṛte upākaraṇādeḥ pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: tatas ājyabhāga ante tantre kṛte upākaraṇa ādeḥ pravṛttiḥ
translated: Therefore, after the Ajyabhagas are offered, the procedure is performed, and the Up akarana etc. commence.

analyzed: atra pramāṇam vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will state the proof for this.

analyzed: aparapakṣasya aparāhṇaḥ śreyān iti eṣa ca kālaḥ
translated: And this is the time: 'The afternoon of the dark fortnight is better.'

analyzed: sarvatra prācīnāvītam
translated: Everywhere the sacred thread is worn over the right shoulder.

analyzed: atha svobhūte aṣṭabhyām
translated: Then, on the eighth day of one's own month.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān gṛham ānīya ityādi agni mukha antam sarva
translated: Having brought the Brahmins and doing everything up to the Agni Mukha as in the monthly Shriddha.

analyzed: atha darbheṇa ekena gām striyam pitṛbhyaḥ tvā juṣṭām upākaromi
translated: Then with one Darbha grass, he dedicates the cow or woman with this Mantra: 'I dedicate you to the ancestors, pleasing to them.'

analyzed: iti anena mantreṇa upākaroti
translated: He dedicates with this Mantra.

analyzed: vapā homaḥ
translated: The offering of the omentum.

original: tūṣṇīṃ pañcājyāhutīrhutvā tasyai vapāṃ śrapayitvopastīrṇābhighāritāṃ madhyamenāntamena vā palāśaparṇenottarayā juhoti // / //
analyzed: tūṣṇīm pañca ājya āhutīḥ hutvā tasyai vapām śrapayitvā upastīrṇa abhighāritām madhyamena antamena vā palāśa parṇena uttarayā juhoti
translated: Having offered five Ajya offerings silently, having cooked the omentum of that (animal), having spread clarified butter on it, he offers it with the middle or last Palasha leaf with the next Mantra.

original: tūṣṇīmityanucyamāne sampradānābhāve homānivṛtteḥ devatākalpanāyāṃ prāptāyāṃ yā aitāḥ pāśubandhikyaḥ paśvāhuyaḥ
analyzed: tūṣṇīm iti an ucyamāne sampradāna abhāve homa anivṛtteḥ devatā kalpanāyām prāptāyām yāḥ aitāḥ pāśubandhikyaḥ paśu āhuyaḥ
translated: If 'silently' is not stated, in the absence of the recipient, the offering would cease. When the conception of a deity is obtained, those which are related to the animal sacrifice, the animal offerings,

original: 'upākṛtya pañca juhotī'ti vihitāḥ tā etā iti vijñāyeta /
analyzed: upākṛtya pañca juhoti iti vihitāḥ tāḥ etāḥ iti vijñāyeta
translated: It would be understood that these are the same as those enjoined by the statement Having dedicated, he offers five oblations.

analyzed: tatas ca mantreṣu api prāpteṣu tūṣṇīm iti uktam
translated: And therefore, even when the mantras are obtained, it is said silently.

original: evaṃ brūvan etaddarśayati śrautasya paśerāvṛtāṣasyāpi paśossaṃskāra iti /
analyzed: evam brūvan etat darśayati śrautasya paśeḥ āvṛtāṣasya api paśoḥ saṃskāraḥ iti
translated: Speaking thus, he shows that the consecration is of the animal of the Vṛtāṣa sacrifice, even though it is enjoined by the Veda.

original: tena 'purastāt pratyañcaṃ tiṣṭavta'mityevamādayo viśeṣā ihāpi bhavanti /
analyzed: tena purastāt pratyañcam tiṣṭavtam iti evamādayaḥ viśeṣāḥ iha api bhavanti
translated: Therefore, the specifications such as standing in front facing west and so on are also applicable here.

original: tasyā iti vacanaṃ tasyā vapāyā evātra codito viśeṣo yathāsyāt śrapaṇādi /
analyzed: tasyāḥ iti vacanam tasyāḥ vapāyāḥ eva atra ca uditaḥ viśeṣaḥ yathā asyāt śrapaṇa ādi
translated: The statement of that is for the purpose of specifying that the consecration, cooking, etc. should be done only to the omentum, not to the meat or cooked rice, etc.

analyzed: na avadānam iti evamartham
translated: This is the meaning of not to the meat or cooked rice, etc.

analyzed: tena māṃsa odana ādeḥ māsiśrāddha vat anyasmin agnau saṃskāraḥ  ājya grahaṇam anarthakam
translated: Therefore, the consecration of the meat or cooked rice, etc. should be done in another fire, like the monthly Śrāddha.🔽The mention of clarified butter is meaningless.

analyzed: api vā uttarayā juhoti iti vat siddham
translated: It is established as in the case of he offers with the next mantra.

analyzed: tat kriyate jñāpaka artham
translated: That is done for the purpose of indicating.

analyzed: etat jñāpayati ājyabhāga ante tantre kṛte paśoḥ upākaraṇa ādi iti
translated: This indicates that after the Ājyabhāgas have been performed, the dedication of the animal and so on should be done.

analyzed: katham kṛtvā jñāpakam
translated: How is it an indication?

original: sarvatra pradhānāhutiṣu tāntrikasya haviṣassadharmakasyānekatve sati viśeṣaṇaṃ dṛśyatesthālīpākādannādājyāhutiritu /
analyzed: sarvatra pradhāna āhutiṣu tāntrikasya haviṣaḥ sadharmakasya aneka tve sati viśeṣaṇam dṛśyate sthālīpākāt annāt ājya āhutiḥ itu
translated: In all cases, when the oblations of the principal offering have the same properties as the offering of the Tantras, and there are many of them, a specification is seen, such as the offering of clarified butter from the cooked rice of the Sthālīpāka.

analyzed: tat iha api dṛṣṭam
translated: This is seen here also.

analyzed: tat jñāpayati tāntrikeṇa eva ājya ūna āhutayaḥ uhabayantaḥ iti
translated: That indicates that they offer the oblations with the Ajya only according to the Tantras.

analyzed: upākaraṇasya ca etāsām ca ānantarya dṛśyate
translated: And the immediacy of the Upākaraṇa and these is seen

analyzed: upākṛtya pañca
translated: Having performed the Upākaraṇa, he offers five oblations.

analyzed: tasmāt ājyabhāga ante paśoḥ upākaraṇam iti siddham bhavati
translated: Therefore, it is established that the Upākaraṇa of the animal is at the end of the Ajyabhāgas.

original: evaṃ pañcājyāhutīrhutvā tūṣṇīṃ saṃjñapya vapāñca vapāśrapaṇībhyāṃ tūṣṇīmuddhṛtya
analyzed: evam pañca ājya āhutīḥ hutvā tūṣṇīm saṃjñapya vapām ca vapāśrapaṇībhyām tūṣṇīm uddhṛtya
translated: Having thus offered five Ajya oblations, having silently slaughtered, having silently lifted up the omentum with the omentum-forks,

original: aupāsane śrapayitvābhighārya barhiṣi pratiṣṭhāpya punarabhighārya tatastāmupastīrṇābhighāritāṃ
analyzed: aupāsane śrapayitvā abhighārya barhiṣi pratiṣṭhāpya punar abhighārya tatas tām upastīrṇa abhighāritām
translated: having cooked it in the Upaśaya, having poured clarified butter over it, having placed it on the sacrificial grass, having again poured clarified butter over it, then that which is covered with clarified butter,

original: madhyamenāntamena vā palāśaparṇena juhoti uttarayarcā 'vaha vapā'mityetayā /🔽parmasya vapāśrapaṇyośca pātraissaha sādanādi bhavati ////
analyzed: madhyamena antamena vā palāśa parṇena juhoti uttarayā ṛcā vaha vapām iti etayā  parmasya vapāśrapaṇyoḥ ca pātraiḥ saha sādana ādi bhavati
translated: he offers it with the middle or innermost leaf of Butea frond with the northern verse Carry the omentum with this.🔽The placing etc. of the omentum-forks and the vessels of the animal is done.

analyzed: tūṣṇīm svāhākāreṇa api vinā pañca ājya āhutīḥ juhoti
translated: He offers the five Ajya oblations silently, even without the Svāhā exclamation.

analyzed: mantra prāpti abhāvāt
translated: Because the attainment of the mantra is absent.

analyzed: devatā ca āsām prajāpatiḥ eva  tasyai vapām ityādi vyākhyātam
translated: And the deity of these is Prajāpati himself.🔽To him the omentum and so on has been explained.

analyzed: uttarayā avaha vapām iti etayā
translated: With the northern verse Carry the omentum with this.

analyzed: māṃsa odana homāḥ
translated: The oblations of meat and rice.

original: māṃsaudamuttarābhiḥ // / //🔽hutāyāṃ vapāyāṃ paśorviśasanaṃ kārayitvā anvaṣṭakārtha / / /gṛheṣu śrapayitvā anyāni
analyzed: māṃsa odam uttarābhiḥ  hutāyām vapāyām paśoḥ viśasanam kārayitvā anvaṣṭakā artha gṛheṣu śrapayitvā anyāni
translated: With the next (verses) the flesh and rice-pap.🔽When the omentum has been offered, he should cause the animal to be cut up, and having had the (various parts) cooked in the houses for the sake of the eight (sacrifices),

original: ca haviṣyaudanādīni tānyabhighārya barhiṣi pratiṣṭhāpya punarabhighārya darvyā juhotyavadānakalpena /
analyzed: ca haviṣya odana ādīni tāni abhighārya barhiṣi pratiṣṭhāpya punar abhighārya darvyā juhoti avadāna kalpena
translated: and the other oblations, rice-pap, &c., he should pour (clarified butter) over them, place them on the sacrificial grass, pour (clarified butter) over them again, and offer them with the dipping-spoon, according to the rule of the Avadânas.

analyzed: na atra sakṛt upaghāta kalpaḥ
translated: Here (in this case) there is no rule of the one (oblation) being poured into the other.

analyzed: sviṣṭakṛti vipratiṣedhāt
translated: Because of the contradiction (of the rule of the one being poured into the other) in the case of the Sviṣṭakṛt (oblation).

analyzed: ājye bhāvāt
translated: Because there is no (oblation of) ghee (in the case of the Sviṣṭakṛt),

analyzed: māṃsa piṣṭa odanayoḥ ca bhāvāt
translated: and because there is (in this case) a rice-pap mixed with meat.

original: tatramāṃsaudanamuttarābhiḥ yāṃ janāḥ pratinandanti'ityetābhiḥ saptabhiḥ /🔽māṃsamiśra odano māṃsaudanaḥ /
analyzed: tatra māṃsa odanam uttarābhiḥ yām janāḥ pratinandanti iti etābhiḥ saptabhiḥ  māṃsa miśraḥ odanaḥ māṃsa odanaḥ
translated: Of that rice-pap mixed with meat he offers the first seven (oblations) with the seven (verses), 'Those people whom thou hast gladdened' .🔽Rice-pap mixed with meat is flesh and rice-pap.

analyzed: homa kāle ca miśraṇam
translated: The mixture (of the meat and rice-pap) takes place at the time of the oblation.

analyzed: na śrapaṇa kāle
translated: Not at the time of the cooking.

analyzed: pakti vaiṣamyāt
translated: Because of the inequality of the cooking.

analyzed: asmin karmaṇi aṣṭādaśa homa mantrāḥ samāmnātāḥ
translated: In this rite eighteen oblation-formulas are recited.

analyzed: ṛcaḥ daśa yajūṃṣi aṣṭau
translated: Ten Ṛc-verses and eight Yajuṣ-formulas.

analyzed: tatra ādyā ṛk apūpa arthā
translated: Of them the first Ṛc-verse is for the cake.

analyzed: vapā arthā uttarā
translated: The next (verses) are for the omentum.

analyzed: uttara ādibhiḥ iti strī liṅga nirdeśaḥ
translated: The direction (in the text) by the feminine gender, 'with the next (verses),'

analyzed: piṣṭānnam uttarayā iti vakṣyati

analyzed: na anvaṣṭakāyāḥ

analyzed: yayā yām janāḥ iti etayā apūpam juhoti

analyzed: na anvaṣṭakāyāḥ api

analyzed: tena ubhayoḥ api pakṣayoḥ navamyām anvaṣṭakā nityā eva

analyzed: ayam ca dadhi homa vidhiḥ homānām eva sthāne

analyzed: dadhnaḥ eva añjalinā juhoti iti juhoti śabdasya svārasyāt

original: tenāsminnapi pakṣe brāhmaṇabhojana piṇḍa pradāna yorāvṛttiḥ /

analyzed: navamyām anvaṣṭakā api iti siddham

analyzed: bhūyāṃsam atas māhiṣeṇa ityādīnām nivṛtti arthaḥ evakāraḥ

original: ata eva goraṣṭakāyāmālabdhāyāḥ māṃsaṃ yathārtha yathāprayojanaṃ śiṣṭvā ityetatprathamapakṣaviṣayam ////

analyzed: tasyāḥ māsiśrāddhena kalpaḥ vyākhyātaḥ

analyzed: māsiśrāddha vat anvaṣṭakā kartavyā iti arthaḥ

analyzed: aṣṭakāyām darśanāt

analyzed: iha ca yathārtha māṃsam iti vacanāt

analyzed: anye māsiśrāddha atideśāt annasya ava homam icchanti

original: yatraiva tu kārye māsi śrāddhe māṃsaṃ ihāpi tatraiveti /

analyzed: navam ca tat śrāddham ca iti kṛtvā

analyzed: yat atra dīyate jantoḥ tat navaśrāddham ucyate

analyzed: iti

analyzed: ādyam tu su ā śocante

analyzed: antyam ca sapiṇḍīkaraṇena saha mṛta ahaḥ eva trāpakṣikam ṣāṇmāsikam dvitīya ādiṣu samvatsareṣu pratisamvatsaram mṛta ahaḥ eva sāmvatsarikam iti ṣoḍaśa etāni ekoddiṣṭāni
translated: And the last is performed on the death anniversary itself along with the Sapindikarana. The three-monthly, six-monthly, and annual ones are performed on the death anniversary itself in the second and subsequent years, and the annual one is performed every year. Thus these sixteen are Ekoddista.

original: sāmvatsarike ca kṣetrajajārajayoḥ ekoddiṣṭakalpasya ca vikalpaḥ /
analyzed: sāmvatsarike ca kṣetraja jārajayoḥ ekoddiṣṭa kalpasya ca vikalpaḥ

analyzed: itareṣām ekoddiṣṭam eva

original: ye navaśrāddhānāṃ samuccayamicchanti teṣāṃ ṣoḍaśaikoddiṣṭānītyeṣāpi prasiddhirdurupapādā /

analyzed: atra paṭhanti
translated: Here they recite:

analyzed: nitya śrāddham māsi māsi a paryāpta āvṛttum prati
translated: The monthly ancestral offering is to be done every month, even if there is insufficient income, and for each season.

original: dvādaśāhena vā bhojyā ekāhe dvādaśāpi vā //
analyzed: dvādaśa ahena vā bhojyāḥ eka ahe dvādaśa api vā
translated: Or one may feed them on the twelfth day, or on the same day every month for twelve months.

original: atha sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ samvatsara ekādaśe caturthe tṛtīye vā māsi tripakṣe ardhamāse dvādaśe vāhani upanayanābhyudayaprāptau vā /
analyzed: atha sapiṇḍīkaraṇam samvatsare ekādaśe caturthe tṛtīye vā māsi tri pakṣe ardha māse dvādaśe vā ahani upanayana abhyudaya prāptau vā
translated: Now, the Sapindikarana is to be done in the eleventh year, or in the fourth or third month, or in three fortnights, or in half a month, or in the twelfth year, or at the time of the Upanayana or Abhiyupavita ceremony.

analyzed: tatra ekoddiṣṭasya māsiśrāddhasya ca samuccayaḥ
translated: There, the Ekoddista and the monthly ancestral offering are to be combined.

original: pretasyaikoddiṣṭaṃ tasya ye ptrādayaḥ tebhyo māsiśrāddhaṃ mantreṣu ca na kścidvikāraḥ /
analyzed: pretasya ekoddiṣṭam tasya ye ptṛ ādayaḥ tebhyaḥ māsiśrāddham mantreṣu ca na kścid vikāraḥ
translated: The Ekoddista is for the deceased, and the monthly ancestral offering is for his father and others. There is no change in the mantras.

original: yanme mātetyādiṣu yathaiva te pitrā pretena pūrva prayuktāstathāva putreṇāpi prayoktavyāḥ /
analyzed: yat me mātā ityādiṣu yathā eva te pitrā pretena pūrva prayuktāḥ tathā ava putreṇa api prayoktavyāḥ
translated: In the mantras beginning with Whatever my mother... and so on, just as they were previously used by his father, the deceased, they are to be used by the son in the same way.

analyzed: putrāt anyasya ca sapiṇḍīkaraṇe na adhikāraḥ
translated: And one other than the son has no right to the Sapindikarana.

analyzed: māsiśrāddha abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no monthly ancestral offering.

analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇā asya ca māsiśrāddha prayoga vikāra tvāt
translated: And because the Sapindikarana is a modification of the performance of the monthly ancestral offering.

original: tasmādaputrasya pretasya bhāryā yāvajjīvamekoddiṣṭakalpenaiva patye māsiśrāddhaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tasmāt aputrasya pretasya bhāryā yāvajjīvam ekoddiṣṭa kalpena eva patye māsiśrāddham dadāti
translated: Therefore, the wife of a deceased sonless man gives the monthly ancestral offering to her husband for as long as she lives, as if it were an Ekoddista.

analyzed: putraḥ pi a kṛta vivāhaḥ evam eva
translated: And a son who has not yet married does the same.

original: vivāhādūrdhva yadā māsiśrāddhamārabhate tadā pituḥ sapiṇḍīkaraṇena sahārabhate /
analyzed: vivāhāt ūrdhva yadā māsiśrāddham ārabhate tadā pituḥ sapiṇḍīkaraṇena saha ārabhate
translated: When, after the marriage, he begins the monthly Sraddha, then he begins it together with the Sapindikarana of his father.

analyzed: anye tu etat anuṣṭhānam anyathā api bhavati
translated: Others, however, perform this rite in a different way.

original: tatra pitre pretāya pūrvavadbhasmani homaḥ itarebhyo 'nnādājyācca māsiśrāddhavat /🔽piṇḍadānemāsiśrāddhavatpiṇḍān datvā tatsamīpe pṛthak stīrṇeṣu darbheṣu pretāya piṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: tatra pitre pretāya pūrvavat bhasmani homaḥ itarebhyaḥ nnāt ājyāt ca māsiśrāddha vat  piṇḍa dāne māsiśrāddha vat piṇḍān da tvā tad samīpe pṛthak stīrṇeṣu darbheṣu pretāya piṇḍaḥ
translated: There, the Homa in the ashes is performed for the father and the departed one as before. For the others, from the food and ghee, as in the monthly Sraddha.🔽Having offered the Pindas in the Pinda-Dâna as in the monthly Sraddha, the Pinda for the departed one is offered on separate Darbha grass spread near it.

original: pūrvavadapo datvā tasyānte arghyārdha pitṛpātreṣu pretapātraṃ prasecayet 'ye samāmā'iti dvābhyāṃ piṇḍaṃ piṇḍeṣu saṃsṛjet /
analyzed: pūrvavat apaḥ da tvā tasya ante arghya ardha pitṛpātreṣu pretapātram prasecayet ye dvābhyām piṇḍam piṇḍeṣu saṃsṛjet
translated: Having offered water as before, at the end of it, he should sprinkle the departed one's vessel in the vessels of the manes with half of the Arghya, with the two (Mantras), 'Ye Samânamânaḥ' . He should mix the Pinda with the Pindas with the two (Mantras), 'Ye Samânamânaḥ' .

analyzed: etat sapiṇḍīkaraṇam
translated: This is the Sapindikarana.

analyzed: etasmin kṛte pretaḥ pitṛ tvam āpadyate
translated: When this is done, the departed one attains the state of a manes.

analyzed: caturthaḥ ca anujñāpitaḥ utsṛṣṭaḥ bhavati
translated: And the fourth, when permitted, becomes released.

original: atra vipratipttiḥ kecitprapitāmahasya pātraṃ piṇḍaṃ cetareṣu saṃsṛjanti /
analyzed: atra vipratipttiḥ kecid prapitāmahasya pātram piṇḍam ca itareṣu saṃsṛjanti
translated: Here there is a dispute. Some mix the vessel and the Pinda of the great-great-grandfather with the others.

translated: and in other extraordinary occurrences, on the new moon night, where one does not hear the sound of water, from the kindling of the sacred fire up to the offering of the sacrificial portion,

analyzed: uttarāḥ āhutīḥ hutvā jaya ādi pratipadyate
translated: Having offered the northern oblations, he should undertake the rites of victory etc.

analyzed: atha adibhuta utpāta prāyaścittam
translated: Now, the expiation for extraordinary portents.

analyzed: adbhutam apūrvam adṛṣṭa caram
translated: An extraordinary thing is something unprecedented and unseen.

analyzed: tasya adbhutasya adṛṣṭacarasya
translated: Of that extraordinary thing, which is unseen,

analyzed: utpātaḥ upajanaḥ yat vā ūrdhva bhavā
translated: a portent is its appearance, or what arises above.

analyzed: adbhuta aviśeṣāḥ eva utpātāḥ divyāḥ āntarikṣyāḥ ca
translated: Portents are indeed special extraordinary events, both divine and atmospheric.

analyzed: rātrau indradhanuḥ lohinī dyauḥ āditye kīla darśanam ityādayaḥ
translated: Such as a rainbow at night, a red sky, the appearance of a halo around the sun, and so on.

analyzed: tasmin pakṣe dbhuta śabdena bhaumāni ucyante govalīvarda nyāyena
translated: In that case, the word extraordinary refers to earthly events by the principle of cow's dewlap,

analyzed: dvandvaḥ ca samāsaḥ
translated: and the compound is a dvandva.

analyzed: tatra udāharaṇa rūpeṇa kānicid adbhutāni darśayati agāra sthūṇā iti
translated: Among them, he shows some extraordinary events in the form of examples, beginning with the pillar of the house.

analyzed: virehaṇam aṅkura upajananam
translated: Vi-rehaṇa means the appearance of sprouts.

analyzed: agāra grahaṇāt ātmīyeṣu api śūdra ṛha ādiṣu na bhavati
translated: Because of the mention of house, it does not happen even in one's own property such as a Śūdra's house.

analyzed: madhunaḥ upaveśaneagāre iti eva
translated: In the case of honey being placed in the house, it is just in the house.

analyzed: kuptuḥ cullī bhrāṣṭram iti anarthāntaram
translated: Kuptus, chulī, bhrasṭra are not different words.

original: kapotasya pakṣiṇa āraṇyasyapadadarśane pacanāgāre tasmin praviṣṭa ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: kapotasya pakṣiṇaḥ pacana āgāre tasmin praviṣṭaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: In the case of the appearance of the foot of a wild pigeon, it means that it has entered that cooking house.

analyzed: amātyāḥ putra ādayaḥ
translated: Ministers are sons and others.

analyzed: teṣām bahūnām yugapad śarīra reṣaṇe
translated: In the case of many of them simultaneously shaking their bodies.

analyzed: vyādhau maraṇe ca
translated: And in sickness and death.

analyzed: anyeṣu ca evaṃprakāreṣu valmīka ādiṣu indradhanuḥ ādiṣu ca
translated: And in other such cases, in anthills and so on, and in rainbows and so on.

analyzed: anyeṣu iti vacanāt amātyānām śarīra iṣaṇam api adbhuta rūpam eva gṛhyate
translated: By the word 'other', the shaking of the bodies of ministers is also taken as a form of wonder.

original: naikasya dvayorvā reṣaṇe kālabhede ca na bhavati /
analyzed: na ekasya dvayoḥ vā reṣaṇe kāla bhede ca na bhavati
translated: It does not occur when one or two people shake, or when there is a difference in time.

original: atra prāyaścittamamāvāsyāthāṃ niśāyāṃ caturdhāvibhaktāyāṃ rātreḥ dvatīyo bhāgo nśā /
analyzed: atra prāyaścittam amāvāsyā athām niśāyām caturdhā vibhaktāyām rātreḥ dvatīyaḥ bhāgaḥ nśā
translated: Here, the expiation is on the new moon night, when the night is divided into four parts, the second part of the night is the night.

original: yatra pradeśe apāṃ kumbhairudadhāneṣvānīyamānānāṃ śabdaṃ na śṛṇuyāt tatra pradeśe 'gnerupasamādhānādyuttarā āhutaya ekādaśa imaṃ me varuṇa
analyzed: yatra pradeśe apām kumbhaiḥ udadhāneṣu ānīyamānānām śabdam na śṛṇuyāt tatra pradeśe gneḥ upasamādhāna ādi uttarāḥ āhutayaḥ ekādaśa imam me varuṇa
translated: In the place where one does not hear the sound of water pots being brought in the fire-pans, in that place, after kindling the fire, the subsequent eleven oblations are offered with the mantras 'Varuṇa'

analyzed: prajāpate iti prajāpate na tvat etāni iti eṣā gṛhyate
translated: 'Prajāpati' 'Prajāpati, these are not yours' - this is taken.

analyzed: prasiddheḥ
translated: Because of the well-known fact.

original: na 'prajāpate tvaṃ nidhipā'ityeṣā /🔽prajāpate natvaditi cahutvā pradhānahurtārjuhuyāt iti tantraśeṣaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: na prajāpate tvam nidhi pā iti eṣā  prajāpate natvat iti ca hutvā pradhāna hurtāt juhuyāt iti tantra śeṣam pratipadyate
translated: Not 'Prajāpati, you are the guardian' - this.🔽Having offered with 'Prajāpati, these are not yours', one should commence the remaining part of the ritual with 'I offer to you, O Agni, the first oblation' - this is understood.

original: ājyabhāgānta ityevaṃ tantrasamāptau siddhāyāṃ agnerupamādhānādivacanaṃ agnimātrasyopasamādhānārtham /
analyzed: ājyabhāga antaḥ iti evam tantra samāptau siddhāyām agneḥ upamādhāna ādi vacanam agni mātrasya upasamādhāna artham
translated: After the Ajyabhagas, when the completion of the ritual is thus established, the statement about kindling the fire and so on is for the purpose of kindling the fire alone.

analyzed: tena aupāsana abhāve laukike pi bhavati
translated: Therefore, when the regular rites are not performed, they are performed even in the ordinary fire.

original: evaṃprakārāṇāmeteṣāṃ naimittikānāṃ dṛṣṭaphalānāṃ ca paṇyahomādīnāṃ anyasminnapyagnau pravṛttipradarśanārtha sarvānte agnividhānārtho yatnaḥ 🔽kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: evaṃprakārāṇām eteṣām naimittikānām dṛṣṭa phalānām ca paṇya homa ādīnām anyasmin api agnau pravṛtti pradarśana artha sarva ante agni vidhāna arthaḥ yatnaḥ  kṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, effort has been made at the very end of all these occasional rites and visible-fruited rites such as the sale-oblations, for the purpose of prescribing fire, to show that they are performed in another fire as well.

analyzed: dayā ādi vacanam ānantarya artham
translated: The word immediately is for the purpose of sequence.

analyzed: pradhāna āhuti anantaram jaya ādi eva prati patyate
translated: Immediately after the principal oblation, only the Jaya etc. are prescribed,

original: na sūtrāntaradṛśṭā āhutayo 'smin tantre hotavyāḥ iti /
analyzed: na sūtra antara dṛśṭāḥ āhutayaḥ smin tantre hotavyāḥ iti
translated: not the oblations seen in other sūtras should be offered in this treatise.

analyzed: kāḥ punar tāḥ
translated: What are they?

original: kapotaścedagāramupahanyādanupatedvā devāḥ kapotaḥ iti pratyṛcaṃ juhuyāt japedvā /
analyzed: kapotaḥ ced agāram upahanyāt anupatet vā devāḥ kapotaḥ iti pratyṛcam juhuyāt japet vā
translated: If a pigeon were to alight on the house or fly away, the gods are the pigeon, one should offer oblations or murmur the verse.

analyzed: iti āśvalāyanaḥ
translated: Thus says Aśvalāyana.

analyzed: jayadi vacanena eva tantra samuccaya pretiṣedhaḥ
translated: The prohibition of the collection of the entire ritual is by the very statement of Jaya.

original: tadapi prāyaścittaṃ vikalpena bhavati pṛthaktantra iti /
analyzed: tat api prāyaścittam vikalpena bhavati pṛthak tantre iti
translated: That expiation also occurs optionally in a separate ritual.

analyzed: tatra api śamyāḥ paridhi arthe
translated: There also, the clod is for the purpose of the enclosing sticks.

analyzed: asya api prāyaścittasya asmin eva śāstre upadiṣṭa tvāt
translated: This expiation is also taught in this very treatise.

analyzed: tatra a dubhatāḥ svabhāvataḥ pūrvam abhūtāḥ santaḥ bhavanti iti
translated: There, the undesirable ones, being previously non-existent by nature, become existent.

original: utpātā iti tu ūrdhva bhavanti anyaktāvasthāyāṃ prāpnunuvanti /
analyzed: utpātāḥ iti tu ūrdhva bhavanti anyakta avasthāyām prāpnunuvanti
translated: But the portents occur later, in a different state.

analyzed: adbhutāḥ ca utpātāḥ ca iti dvandva samāsa
translated: And the portents are wondrous. This is a copulative compound.

analyzed: śabda bhedaḥ tu bhauma divya bheda abhiprāyaḥ
translated: But the difference in words is intended to distinguish between earthly and heavenly portents.

original: tatra divyā utpātā rātrāvindradhanu rādityakīla ityādayaḥ bhaumāṃstvadbhutānagārasthūṇetyādinā svayamevodāharati /
analyzed: tatra divyāḥ utpātāḥ rātrau indradhanuḥ ādityakīlaḥ ityādayaḥ bhaumān tu adbhutān agāra sthūṇā ityādinā svayam eva udāharati
translated: Among them, heavenly portents are the rainbow at night, the sun's halo, and so on. But earthly wondrous portents are exemplified by himself with the sprouting of the house-pillar and so on.

analyzed: agārasya sthūṇāḥ agārasthūṇāḥ
translated: The pillars of the house are house-pillars.

original: tāsāṃ virohaṇe aṅkuropajanane /🔽sthūṇāgrahaṇaṃ cānyasyāpi gṛhasambandhino vaṃśādranikhātasyāpi pradarśanārtham /
analyzed: tāsām virohaṇe aṅkura upajanane  sthūṇā grahaṇam ca anyasya api gṛha sambandhinaḥ vaṃśa adra nikhātasya api pradarśana artham
translated: In their sprouting, in the production of sprouts.🔽And the mention of pillars is for the purpose of showing other things connected with the house, such as bamboo, which is not planted.

analyzed: nimitta gata viśeṣaṇa tvāt madhunaḥ upaveśanā eti agāre eva
translated: Because it is a qualifier in the reason. The seating of honey is only in the house.

analyzed: upasarjanasya api agāra śabdasya yogya tvena buddhyā vibhajya sambandhaḥ
translated: Even though the word house is a subordinate term, the connection is made by dividing it conceptually due to its suitability.

analyzed: ārāma ādiṣu an adbhuta tvāt
translated: Because it is not wondrous in gardens and so on.

analyzed: kuptuḥ cullī bhrāṣṭram ambarīṣam iti anarthāntaram
translated: The hearth, oven, and pot are synonyms.

analyzed: tasyām kuptvām pacana āgāre iti arthaḥ
translated: In that hearth, the meaning is the cooking place.

analyzed: kapotasya api āraṇyasya pakṣi viśeṣa sya pada darśane
translated: And in seeing the footprint of even the wild pigeon, a particular bird.

analyzed: kup tvām iti ati pradarśana artham
translated: The word etc. is for the purpose of illustration.

analyzed: antargṛhe pi asya a dubhuta tvāt
translated: Because it is inauspicious even inside the house.

analyzed: amā saha vasanti iti amātyāḥ
translated: Those who live together with the mother are the maternal relatives.

original: ekapātrabhojanāḥ putrabhrātrādayaḥ teṣāṃ bahūnāṃ santataṃśarīrareṣaṇeśarīranāśane maraṇa ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: eka pātra bhojanāḥ putra bhrātṛ ādayaḥ teṣām bahūnām maraṇe iti arthaḥ
translated: Those who eat from the same plate, such as sons, brothers, etc., the destruction of the bodies of many of them, the death, is meant.

analyzed: kecid amātyānām yugapad vyādhau api iti
translated: Some say it is when many maternal relatives become sick at the same time.

original: anyeṣu cādubhutotpāteṣuuktebhyo 'nyeṣu gṛhamadhye valmīkajananādiṣvadibhuteṣu usāteṣu ca dṛṣeṣu satsu tatsūcitaduritaśāntyādikāmo 'māvāsyāyāṃniśāyāṃ
analyzed: anyeṣu ca a dubhuta utpāteṣu uktebhyaḥ nyeṣu gṛha madhye valmīka janana ādiṣu a dibhuteṣu ca satsu tad sūcita durita śānti ādi kāmaḥ māvāsyāyām niśāyām
translated: And in other inauspicious occurrences, in other inauspicious events such as the appearance of an anthill inside the house, etc., and in the presence of seen and unseen [inauspicious events], one who desires the pacification of the sin indicated by them, on the new moon night,

analyzed: rātryām muhūrta dvayāt ūrdhvam
translated: after two muhūrtas of the night.

analyzed: kecid dvitīye yāme iti
translated: Some say it is in the second watch.

analyzed: yatra apām vahantīnām śabdam na śṛṇuyāt kecid kumbhaiḥ udadhāneṣu ānīyamānāsu iti
translated: Where one does not hear the sound of carrying water, some say when it is being brought in pots to the water-pots.

analyzed: tathābūte deśe agneḥ upasamādhāna ādi tantram pratipadyate
translated: In such a place, one undertakes the ritual beginning with the kindling of the sacred fire.

original: tantravidhānaṃ cāsya ājyahaviṣṭvāt / ājyabāgānte iti tvarthakṛtyapratiṣedhārtham /
analyzed: tantra vidhānam ca asya ājya haviḥ tvāt ājyabāga ante iti tu artha kṛtya pratiṣedha artham
translated: And the injunction of the ritual is because it has clarified butter as the offering material. But at the end of the portions of clarified butter is for the purpose of prohibiting the performance of the purpose.

analyzed: uttarāḥ āhutīḥ imam me varuṇa
translated: The subsequent oblations are O Varuṇa, this one of mine...

analyzed: tatvā ayāmi iti ekādaśa āhutīḥ hutvā vacana balāt jaya ādi pratipadyate
translated: Having offered eleven oblations with the formula, 'I come to thee,' one attains victory etc. by the force of the statement.

original: atra prajāpati iti pratīkena 'prājāpatyā vyāhṛtīḥ'itivat 'prajāpate na tvadetāni'ityeṣaiva gṛhyate ////
analyzed: atra prajāpate iti pratīkena prājāpatyāḥ vyāhṛtīḥ iti vat prajāpate na tvat etāni iti eṣā eva gṛhyate
translated: Here, just as in 'The Vyāhṛtis of Prajāpati,' the word 'Prajāpati' is taken as referring to the same deity, so also in 'O Prajāpati, these are not thine,' the same deity is referred to.

original: pariṣecanāntaṃ kṛtvābhimṛtebhya uttarayā dakṣiṇato 'śmānaṃ paridhiṃ dadhāti dadhāti // / //
analyzed: pariṣecana antam kṛtvā abhimṛtebhyaḥ uttarayā dakṣiṇatas śmānam paridhim dadhāti dadhāti
translated: Having performed the rites ending with the sprinkling, he places to the south of the touched persons a stone as a boundary with the next verse.

original: ata amātyānāṃ śarīrareṣaṇe ityasminnadbhute kaścidviśeṣaḥ yeṣāṃ pūrvāparā anvañcaḥ
analyzed: ata amātyānām śarīra reṣaṇe iti asmin adbhute kaścid viśeṣaḥ yeṣām pūrva aparāḥ anvañcaḥ
translated: In this portent of the shaking of the bodies of the ministers, there is a certain difference. Those whose bodies are shaken from east to west

original: pramīyante te abhimṛtāstebhyastadartha teṣāṃ mṛtyuśamanārtha uttaraṃ karma homamimaṃ
analyzed: pramīyante te abhimṛtāḥ tebhyaḥ tad artha teṣām mṛtyu śamana arthe uttaram karma homam imam
translated: are touched. For their sake, for the purpose of alleviating their death, this rite of oblation

original: kṛtvā pariṣecanānte 'śmānaṃ paridhi antardhānaṃ mṛttyunivāraṇārtha pratiṣṭhāpayatiuttarayarcā
analyzed: kṛtvā pariṣecana ante śmānam paridhi antardhānam mṛttyu nivāraṇa artha pratiṣṭhāpayati uttarayā ṛcā
translated: is performed. At the end of the sprinkling, he establishes a stone as a boundary for the purpose of preventing death with the next verse,

analyzed: imam jīvebhyaḥ iti etayā
translated: 'This (stone) for the living.'

analyzed: abhyāsaḥ praśva samāpti dyotakaḥ
translated: The repetition indicates the completion of the exhalation.

original: paridhimiti vacanāt tasyāśmanaḥ pracyāvanaṃ na kāryam /
analyzed: paridhim iti vacanāt tasya aśmanaḥ pracyāvanam na kāryam
translated: Because of the statement 'boundary,' that stone should not be removed.

analyzed: tatra eva pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: It remains established there itself.

analyzed: iti śrī haradatta miśra viracitāyām gṛhya vṛttau anākulāyām trayorviṃśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-third section in the Anākulā Gṛhyavṛtti composed by Haradatta Miśra.

analyzed: samāptaḥ ca uttamaḥ ṣṭamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: And the excellent eighth chapter is completed.

analyzed: saṃpūrṇa an ākulā vṛttiḥ
translated: The Anākulā Vṛtti is complete.

analyzed: tatas pariṣecana antam tantra śṣam karoti
translated: Then he performs the entire ritual up to the sprinkling (of water).

analyzed: śamyāḥ paridhi arthe iti pūrvam eva uktam
translated: It has been said earlier that the Samyā is for the purpose of the Parihī.

analyzed: kecid ājyabhāga ante iti anena tantra prāptau siddhāyām agneḥ upasamādhāna ādi vacanam agni mātrasya upasamādhāna artham
translated: Some say that when the completion of the ritual is established by this (verse) ending with the Ajyabhāga, the statement beginning with the rekindling of the fire is for the purpose of rekindling the fire alone.

analyzed: tena aupāsana śūnyasya idam karma laukike bhavati
translated: Therefore, this rite is performed even in worldly (fires) for one who does not have a domestic fire.

analyzed: anyāni ca ivaṃprakārāṇi dṛṣṭa phalāni naimittikāni paṇya homa ādīni
translated: And other rites of this kind which have visible results, such as the Panyahoma, are occasional.

analyzed: asya sarva ante gni vidhānasya sarva artha tva avagamāt iti
translated: Because it is understood that this entire ritual of the fire is for all purposes.

analyzed: abhimṛtebhyaḥ ityādinā amātyānām śarīra reṣaṇā iti asmin adbhute kaścid viśeṣaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: By the words to those who have been touched and so on, a certain distinction is stated in this extraordinary (rite) for the examination of the bodies of the ministers.

original: abhimṛtāabhimukhyena mṛtā yogyatayā jīvanta eva amātyānāṃ santatamaraṇadarśanena svayamapi maraṇādbhītā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: abhimṛtāḥ a bhimukhyena mṛtāḥ yogyatayā jīvantaḥ eva amātyānām santata maraṇa darśanena svayam api maraṇāt bhītāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Those who have been touched means those who are fit to be considered dead by being in front (of the king). The ministers, seeing constant death, are afraid of death themselves. This is the meaning.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ tad artha santata maraṇa bhaya nivṛtti arti auttarayā imam jīvebhyaḥ
translated: For their sake, constantly, in order to remove the fear of death, with the next verse, 'This to the living beings.'🔽

analyzed: iti anayā a paridhim mṛtyoḥ antardhāna bhūtam aśmānam dakṣiṇatas nidadhāti
translated: For their sake, he always places a stone to the south, which is hidden from death, with the next verse, This (stone) to the living, in order to remove the fear of death.

analyzed: etat ca tantra śeṣa ante
translated: And this is at the end of the Tantra.

analyzed: kṛtvā iti ktvā pratyaya balāt
translated: Having done by the force of the ktvā affix.

analyzed: kecid nidadhāti pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Some say he places it, he establishes it.

analyzed: paridhi vacanāt ca tasya aśmanaḥ pracyāvanam na kartavyam iti
translated: And because of the mention of the boundary, that stone should not be removed.

analyzed: dadhāti dadāti iti gviruktiḥ praśna samāpti sūcana ārtā
translated: The repetition of he places and he gives is to indicate the end of the question.

analyzed: ittham sudarśana āryeṇa gṛhya tātparya darśanam
translated: Thus, the Tattva-darśana of the noble Sudarśana

analyzed: kṛtam bhāṣya anusāreṇa yathāmati yathāśrutam
translated: has been composed according to the commentary, as far as my understanding and knowledge allow.

analyzed: atra anuktam duruktam vā mateḥ māndyāt śutasya vā
translated: Whatever has not been mentioned or has been wrongly stated here, due to the weakness of my intellect or of what I have heard,

analyzed: sat mārga pravaṇānām naḥ kṣantum arhanti paṇḍitāḥ
translated: the wise ones should forgive us, who are inclined towards the true path.

original: iti śrīsudarśanācāryaviracite gṛhyatātparyadarśane trayoviṃśaḥ khamḍaḥ asṭamaśca paṭalassamāptaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī sudarśana ācārya viracite gṛhya tātparya darśane trayoviṃśaḥ khamḍaḥ asṭamaḥ ca paṭalaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-third chapter and the eighth discourse in the Tattva-darśana composed by the noble Sudarśana.

analyzed: samāptā iyam gṛhya sūtra vyākhyā
translated: This commentary on the Grihya-sūtras is complete.
